channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2023120049
item.description:
Report X-2023120049

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As the package was being unloaded the package handler noticed the bottom/ side of the box was getting wet. DescribePack: Loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the package was discovered it was placed in a hazmat tote, taken to the damaged hazmat cage, and set under the vent.

item.title: Report E-2023110613
item.description:
Report E-2023110613

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-20
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 20, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2810 fell off the lift gate and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental (GME) to remediate the impacted site. GME personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the UN2810-impacted trailer and roadway. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 95-gallon overpack and taken to the R+L terminal for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023110451
item.description:
Report X-2023110451

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PLASTIC DRUM WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WAS PUT ON AND DRUM WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL TUBS/PPE WERE DECONTAMINATED AND DRUM WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.

ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WAS PUT ON AND JERRICAN WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. JERRICAN WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL TUBS/PPE WERE DECONTAMINATED AND JERRICAN WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.

item.title: Report X-2023110345
item.description:
Report X-2023110345

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY SIX POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING SILVER SALMON. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM WA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 4R1Y32, GLOBAL SEAFOODS NORTH AMERICA, 826 103RD AVE. SE, BELLEVUE WA 98004.

item.title: Report X-2023111088
item.description:
Report X-2023111088

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-30
  • City: DUPONT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA wet and leaking. When inspected, it was found that the cap came loose, spilling the contents inside the package. DescribePack: Loose cap, failed seal. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was bagged and sealed in a HAZMAT drum.

item.title: Report E-2023110488
item.description:
Report E-2023110488

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was pumping diesel fuel into the customer's storage tank. During the delivery, the connection between the storage tank and delivery hose was compromised. This allowed approximately 70 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. Graymar Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2023110487
item.description:
Report E-2023110487

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-22
  • City: COVINGTON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver disconnected the hose from the customer's storage tank without completely draining the residual gasoline from the hose. As a result, approximately 10 gallons of gasoline was released. Graymar Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Cap came loose inside of package, causing product to spill out into package DescribePack: outer packaging soaked in product, causing outer package to become unsuitable for transport DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: package was brought to QA in red tote immediately upon driver coming back to building, mitigating spill

item.title: Report E-2023110098
item.description:
Report E-2023110098

  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: approximately 1 gallon of Diablo 265 was released from a 265-gallon tote due to freight hitting the valve. The release impacted the inside of trailer. A contractor was called to assist with the cleanup of material.
